chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial - 12 person on March 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on February 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

(Case called at 4:00 PM)
Defendant Brandon J Schroeder in court with Attorney Jay E. Heit.  Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense enters Not Guilty pleas - received by Court.  Court notes that this case is set as a #2 trial behind an OWI trial - parties to check on November 1, 2022 for the status of the OWI case.  State had filed Motions in Limine - can be addressed morning of trial as they are mostly standard.  State has objection to #3 and #5 of Defense Motions in Limine.  Defense will subpoena any State witness he wishes to call during his case.  #5 to be discussed as or if they are admitted into evidence.  State's Specific Motion in Limine discussed.  Any discussion the officer may have had with the prosecutor is off limits for both sides at trial.  Trial to begin at 9:00 AM morning of trial (if trial is still going as currently set); parties to arrive by 8:30 AM.

State's Notice of Witnesses
The original document was titled: State's Notice of Witnesses

(11:28 AM case called.) Defendant Brandon J Schroeder in court. Attorney Jay E. Heit in court for Brandon J Schroeder. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the motion is Denied.

Waives reading of the complaint. $500 cash that was posted is to remain in place with addition of conditions as requested by the State. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 7-25-22 at 2:00 PM. Return to Court: 8-15-22 at 9:30 AM.
